H0.text: A plate sitting on a table is the best example of an object with kinetic energy.

H1.text: A bird perching in a tree is the best example of an object with kinetic energy.

H2.text: A marble rolling down a ramp is the best example of an object with kinetic energy.

H3.text: A dam holding back some water is the best example of an object with kinetic energy.

A4.text: The kinetic energy of an object is the form of energy that it possesses due to its motion.

A5.text: The kinetic energy of an object is equal to the work, or force (F) in the direction of motion times its displacement (s), needed to accelerate the object from rest to its given speed.
